newsitem.title: USA: Ligand tests show more uses for Targetrin.
newsitem.headline: Ligand tests show more uses for Targetrin.

text.p: Ligand Pharmaceuticals Inc said Thursday preclinical test results of its Targretin drug, a retinoid, may have some impact treating human type II diabetes and treating or even preventing breast cancer.
Preclinical results showed Targretin, also known as LGD1069, can decrease blood glucose, triglyceride and insulin levels in mice with human type II diabetes and human obesity.
Moreover, in a rat model of mammary carcinoma, Targretin reduced incidence and tumor frequency without a reduction in body weight that is often associated with other treatments.
In a statement, Ligand said the test results "reinforce the concept that retinoid-based drugs may play a major role in treating a variety of diseases."
